newsitem.title: CHINA: CITIC says not considering investment in Thailand.
newsitem.headline: CITIC says not considering investment in Thailand.

text.p: China International Trust and Investment Corp (CITIC) said on Friday it had no current plans to buy troubled enterprises in Thailand.
"At present, we have not yet considered buying enterprises in Thailand," CITIC said in a statement.

Hong Kong's South China Morning Post on Thursday quoted Thailand's Deputy Foreign Minister Pitak Intrawityanut as saying Beijing-based CITIC was "seriously" thinking of investing in Bangkok's troubled finance sector.
The deputy foreign minister was quoted as saying CITIC planned to invest through its Hong Kong banking arm, Ka Wah Bank.
"CITIC...has no obligation to provide economic aid to foreign governments," it said.
"CITIC...buys enterprises out of business considerations," the company said. It gave no further details.
The conglomerate has interests ranging from banking and securities to real estate, telecommunications and manufacturing and controls Hong Kong-listed CITIC Pacific Ltd.
